page.title: 04The Hamble/Warsash ferry
page.content: Mr Ray Sedgewick has a very unusual job because he is the{Hamble/Warsash {ferryman}. He is up in the morning at a quarter to five and works until six o'clock in the evening. Mr Sedgewick only gets two days off every year and that is Christmas Day and Boxing Day.He has been doing this job for{twenty_seven years}. The ferry can carry{ten people}at a time and it costs twenty pence for adults and ten pence for children. The high tide stays for about two hours and then goes out again .The ferry has an outboard motor which helps him cross the quarter of a mile to the other side. The ferry has a{long history}.The earliest recorded evidence of a crossing between Hamble and Warsash was in{1493}but it could be older.
